parts:
text: "<question>Analyze `sample-weather.csv`.

Return a JSON object with keys:
- `average_temp_c`: number
- `max_precip_date`: string
- `min_temp_c`: number
- `temp_precip_correlation`: number
- `average_precip_mm`: number
- `temp_line_chart`: base64 PNG string under 100kB
- `precip_histogram`: base64 PNG string under 100kB

Answer:
1. What is the average temperature in Celsius?
2. On which date was precipitation highest?
3. What is the minimum temperature recorded?
4. What is the correlation between temperature and precipitation?
5. What is the average precipitation in millimeters?
6. Plot temperature over time as a line chart with a red line. Encode as base64 PNG.
7. Plot precipitation as a histogram with orange bars. Encode as base64 PNG.
</question>"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport json\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'Temperature_C\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'Precipitation_mm\'].idxmax(), \'Date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'Temperature_C\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'Temperature_C\'].corr(df[\'Precipitation_mm\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'Precipitation_mm\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'Date\'], df[\'Temperature_C\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(temp_chart, format=\'png\')\\ntemp_chart_b64 = base64.b64encode(temp_chart.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'Precipitation_mm\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_hist = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(precip_hist, format=\'png\')\\nprecip_hist_b64 = base64.b64encode(precip_hist.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close(\'all\')\\n\\n# Create and save the result dictionary.\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_chart_b64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_hist_b64\\n}\\n\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\\n\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport json\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[\'temperature\'].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[\'precipitation\'].idxmax(), \'date\']\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[\'temperature\'].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[\'temperature\'].corr(df[\'precipitation\'])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[\'precipitation\'].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[\'date\'], df[\'temperature\'], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(temp_chart, format=\'png\')\\ntemp_chart_b64 = base64.b64encode(temp_chart.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[\'precipitation\'], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_hist = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(precip_hist, format=\'png\')\\nprecip_hist_b64 = base64.b64encode(precip_hist.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close(\'all\')\\n\\n\\n# Create and save the result dictionary.\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_chart_b64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_hist_b64\\n}\\n\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\\n\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\"], \"run_this\": 1}"

text: "{\"code\": \"import pandas as pd\\nimport json\\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\\nimport base64\\nimport io\\n\\n# Load the dataframe.\\ndf = pd.read_csv(\'sample-weather.csv\')\\n\\n# Get the actual column names\\ntemp_col = df.columns[1]\\nprecip_col = df.columns[2]\\ndate_col = df.columns[0]\\n\\n# 1. Average temperature\\navg_temp = df[temp_col].mean()\\n\\n# 2. Date of highest precipitation\\nmax_precip_date = df.loc[df[precip_col].idxmax(), date_col]\\n\\n# 3. Minimum temperature\\nmin_temp = df[temp_col].min()\\n\\n# 4. Correlation\\ncorrelation = df[temp_col].corr(df[precip_col])\\n\\n# 5. Average precipitation\\navg_precip = df[precip_col].mean()\\n\\n# 6. Temperature line chart\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.plot(df[date_col], df[temp_col], color=\'red\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Date\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Temperature (°C)\')\\nplt.title(\'Temperature over Time\')\\nplt.xticks(rotation=45)\\nplt.tight_layout()\\ntemp_chart = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(temp_chart, format=\'png\')\\ntemp_chart_b64 = base64.b64encode(temp_chart.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\n\\n# 7. Precipitation histogram\\nplt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))\\nplt.hist(df[precip_col], color=\'orange\')\\nplt.xlabel(\'Precipitation (mm)\')\\nplt.ylabel(\'Frequency\')\\nplt.title(\'Precipitation Distribution\')\\nplt.tight_layout()\\nprecip_hist = io.BytesIO()\\nplt.savefig(precip_hist, format=\'png\')\\nprecip_hist_b64 = base64.b64encode(precip_hist.getvalue()).decode(\'utf-8\')\\nplt.close(\'all\')\\n\\n\\n# Create and save the result dictionary.\\nresult = {\\n    \\\"average_temp_c\\\": avg_temp,\\n    \\\"max_precip_date\\\": max_precip_date,\\n    \\\"min_temp_c\\\": min_temp,\\n    \\\"temp_precip_correlation\\\": correlation,\\n    \\\"average_precip_mm\\\": avg_precip,\\n    \\\"temp_line_chart\\\": temp_chart_b64,\\n    \\\"precip_histogram\\\": precip_hist_b64\\n}\\nwith open(\'result.json\', \'w\') as f:\\n    json.dump(result, f)\", \"libraries\": [\"pandas\", \"matplotlib\"], \"run_this\": 1}"
